projects.description: In this project I wrote the CSS and the HTML from 0, and used JavaScript for the first time. I had to make the CSS Grid thumbnail gallery responsive without utilizing media queries, and wrote the 'search-content filter' by myself, and the best helper, dr. Google!

This project is about responsive web page. I wrote the HTML, CSS and Javascript for this project. I had to add Demo alert notification, used Widgets. I add function to navigate between different data in the chart section. I added autocomplete and used local storage

In this project, I build the HTML, CSS and javascript by myself, I had to make a responsive layout and using boostrap, adding a 'kind' of gallery of my projects with links to the live version(now its not working cause I change the repo names), That was my final project at the front-end-web-development

In this project, I create a browser-based, word guessing game: Phrase Hunter. I used JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess, by clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard.

For this project, I built an app for a fictional company called Awesome Startup, a distributed company with remote employees working all over the world. They need a smart way for employees to share contact information with each other.

I took the workshop in teamTreeHouse, Object-Oriented JavaScript: Challenge, I had instructions and after the instructions solution videos, sometimes I used the solution, but the most of the time, I used google as the best dev friend. that was really challenging and took me 5 days to complete.
In this project I build an a calculator by myself with lots of google help, I wanted a good calculator that can serve me in my job, and it is.
the hardest thing I did till today its the clock, it was all the things im struggling with in JavaScript (time functions), so me and google decided to tackle it, and we succeed.
In this project, I used JavaScript to enhance an interactive registration form for a fictional Full Stack conference.

For this first project, I create an app that displays random famous quotes each time a button is clicked. I will select my own quotes from famous historical figures, artists, scientists, celebrities, etc.
in this project I used html and css, and litle bit javascript (for the search function), I added 5 pages of students and used flex CSS to display the cards in the way they are displayed.
